questions.title: Two Sum
questions.description: Given an array of integers nums and an integer target, return indices of the two numbers such that they add up to target.
hints: Use a hashmap to store previously visited numbers.
Check if the complement (target - num) exists in the hashmap.

questions.title: Container With Most Water
questions.description: Given n non-negative integers a1, a2, ..., an, where each represents a point at coordinate (i, ai), find two lines that form a container that holds the most water.
hints: Use two pointers starting from both ends.
Move the pointer with the smaller height.

questions.title: Trapping Rain Water
questions.description: Given n non-negative integers representing an elevation map where the width of each bar is 1, compute how much water it can trap after raining.
hints: Use two pointers from both ends and track max heights.
Keep track of left max and right max values.

questions.title: Product of Array Except Self
questions.description: Given an integer array nums, return an array answer such that answer[i] is equal to the product of all elements except nums[i].
hints: Use left and right product arrays.
Optimize using a single pass approach.

questions.title: Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock
questions.description: You are given an array prices where prices[i] is the price of a given stock on the ith day. Return the maximum profit you can achieve.
hints: Track minimum price seen so far.
Calculate max profit at each step.

questions.title: Reverse Linked List
questions.description: Given the head of a singly linked list, reverse the list and return the reversed list.
hints: Iterate through the list and change the next pointer of each node.
Use three pointers: prev, curr, and next.

questions.title: Merge Two Sorted Lists
questions.description: Merge two sorted linked lists and return it as a sorted list.
hints: Iterate through both lists and compare nodes.

questions.title: Maximum Depth of Binary Tree
questions.description: Given the root of a binary tree, return its maximum depth.
hints: The depth of a node is max depth of left and right child + 1.
